Description: Original tweet in JSON format from the Twitter Stream API
Unique identifier for the tweet
Time and date that the tweet was postedin postgres timestamp format
Day of week from Monday (1) to Sunday (7) that the tweet was posted
Day of the month that the tweet was posted
Month that the tweet was posted
Year that the tweet was posted
Hour that the tweet was posted
Minute that the tweet was posted
Second that the tweet was posted
Whether the tweet is a retweet or not
Whether the tweet is geolocated with coordinates or not
Whether tweet references an approximate place (given by a bounding box) or not
Text content of the tweet
Language that the tweet was written in
Number of times the tweet was favourited
Number of times the tweet was retweeted
Number of times the tweet was quoted
The country that the tweet is associated with, only if there is a tweet place
The short form country code for tweet_country
The place name that the tweet is associated with
The type of the tweet_place such as country, city, admin, etc
The top left corner longitude coordinate of the bounding box representing the tweet_place
The top left corner latitude coordinate of the bounding box representing the tweet_place
The top right corner longitude coordinate of the bounding box representing the tweet_place
The top right corner latitude coordinate of the bounding box representing the tweet_place
The bottom right corner longitude coordinate of the bounding box representing the tweet_place
The bottom right corner latitude coordinate of the bounding box representing the tweet_place
The bottom left corner longitude coordinate of the bounding box representing the tweet_place
The bottom left corner latitude coordinate of the bounding box representing the tweet_place
The postgis geometry object for the tweet_place
The longitude coordinate of the tweet if available
The latitude coordinate of the tweet if available
The postgis geometry object for the tweet coordinates if available
Unique identifier for the user that posted the tweet
Time and date that the user posting the tweet was created in postgres timestamp format
Whether the user posting the tweet is verified or not
Whether user has included a place in their profile
Number of times the user has favourited tweets on Twitter
Number of Twitter followers that the user has
Number of Twitter friends that the user has
Number of times that the user has tweeted
The place name, which is entered manually by the user and may not actually represent an existing place
Unique identifier for original tweet
Unique identifier for the user that posted the original tweet
